etymology.description: semantic: 隹 (‘bird’) + phonetic: 暵 (abbreviated); later phonetically borrowed for other senses.
etymology.interpretation: 隹 contributes the idea of a bird, reflecting that 難 originally named a kind of bird, while the element from 暵 provided the sound nán. The word was later borrowed to express the sense ‘difficult’, and modern 难 is the simplified graphic form of that earlier character.
etymology.simplification: Stroke reduction by replacing the complex left component of 難 with 又, an unorthodox variant recorded since the Ming; proposed in ROC’s 1935 list (retracted 1936) and officially adopted by the PRC in 1956.

examples.chinese: 这个问题很难(這個問題很難)。
学起来不难(學起來不難)。

examples.english: Don’t make things difficult for him.
